Description: Unless "Use Server Name For World Name" is enabled, sets the name of a newly generated world. The world save file will be named accordingly in the Worlds directory. If the save file already exists and is not loaded under World Save Name, then an incrementally numbered save file will be created

Specifies the world save file in the Worlds directory to load on start. Creates the specified file if no World Name is set or "Use Server Name For World Name" is enabled. Creates a default world save file if otherwise unspecified
Sets the world seed to use for a newly generated world. Blank = random seed
Sets the size of a newly generated world
Sets the difficulty level of a newly generated world
Sets the evil state for a newly generated world
Sets the name of the server shown publicly

DisplayName: Use Server Name For World Name
Description: If set, the Server Name will be used as the world name of a newly generated world, with the world save file named as specified under World Save Name
Sets the server's [MOTD](https://ikebukuro.tshock.co/#/motd) (message of the day)
DefaultValue:
Welcome to [c/ffff00:%map%] on [c/7ddff8:T][c/81dbf6:S][c/86d7f4:h][c/8ad3f3:o][c/8ecef1:c][c/93caef:k] for [c/55d284:T][c/62d27a:e][c/6fd16f:r][c/7cd165:r][c/89d15a:a][c/95d150:r][c/a4d145:i][c/b1d03b:a].
[c/FFFFFF:Online players (%onlineplayers%/%serverslots%):] [c/FFFF00:%players%]
Type [c/55D284:%specifier%][c/62D27A:h][c/6FD16F:e][c/7CD165:l][c/89D15A:p] for a list of commands.

Description: Sets the password for players to join the server. Default is no password
If required, you can change the IP binding of the server by editing App.ApplicationIPBinding in GenericModule.kvp for the instance. Stop the instance (not just the server) first
If set, enables the server's anti-spam feature
Sets the language of the server
Enable/Disable the text announcements Announcement Box makes when pulsed from wire
Sets the announcement box text messaging range in pixels, -1 for serverwide announcements
If set, the server’s backup autosave will be enabled. Backups are stored in the tshock/backups folder
If set, world autosave announcements will be enabled
If set, backup autosave messages will be shown
Sets the interval between backup autosaves
Sets how long backup autosaves are kept
If enabled, the world will be saved if the server crashes from an unhandled exception

DisplayName: Save World On Last Player Exit
Description: If enabled, the world will be saved when the last player disconnects
If set, the server will ignore API version checks for plugins, allowing old plugins to run
If set, disables UPnP (Universal Plug and Play) on the server
Sets the server process priority
Specifies additional command line parameters that are not otherwise set by AMP. ONE LINE ONLY! Use with care
If set, the server will be forced to continue running, and not hibernate when no players are connected. This will result in time passing, grass growing, and the CPU running
Sets the size of invasion events, based on: 100 + (multiplier x (number of active players with greater than 200 health))
Sets the default maximum number of mobs that will spawn per wave. Higher = more mobs in that wave
Sets the delay between waves. Lower = more mobs
If set, enables never-ending invasion events. The event still needs to be started, such as with the /invade command
Sets the server's PvP (player vs player) mode
If enabled, prevents tiles from being placed within the Spawn Protection Radius of the default spawn
Sets the tile radius around the spawn tile that is protected by the Spawn Protection setting
If set, enables anti-cheat range checks based on distance between the player and their block placements
If set, only hardcore players cann connect. Don't enable Softcore Only or Mediumcore Only at the same time
If set, softcore players cannot connect. Don't enable Softcore Only or Hardcore Only at the same time
If set, only softcore players can connect. Don't enable Mediumcore Only or Hardcore Only at the same time
If set, disables any placing or removal of blocks
If set, hardmode will not be activated by the Wall of Flesh or the /starthardmode command
If enabled, prevents the dungeon guardian from being spawned, while sending players to their spawn point instead
Disables clown bomb projectiles from spawning
If set, disables snowball projectiles from spawning
If set, disables tombstone dropping during death for all players
If set, disables Skeletron Prime Bombs from spawning. Useful for preventing unwanted world destruction on "for the worthy" seed world
Forces the world time to the specified setting
If set, disables the effect of invisibility potions while PvP is enabled, by making the player visible to the other players
Sets the maximum distance that disabled players can move from
If enabled, region protection will apply to chests

DisplayName: Enable Region Protection For Gem Locks
Description: If enabled, region protection will apply to gem locks
If set, ignores checks to see if a player can update a projectile
If set, ignores checks to see if a player can kill a projectile
Allows players to break temporary tiles (grass, pots, etc) where they cannot usually build
If enabled, allows ice placement even where a player cannot usually build
If enabled, allows the crimson to spread when a world is in hardmode
If set, allows the corruption to spread when a world is in hardmode
Allows the hallow to spread when a world is in hardmode
If enabled, forces Christmas-only events to occur all year
If enabled, forces Halloween-only events to occur all year

DisplayName: Allow Allowed Groups To Spawn Banned Items
Description: Allows groups on the banned item allowed list to spawn banned items even if PreventBannedItemSpawn is set to true
If set, enables the server's whitelist based on IP addresses in whitelist.txt in the tshock directory
Sets the reason given when kicking players for not being on the whitelist
DefaultValue: You are not on the whitelist.

Description: Sets the maximum numbers of players that can connect at one time
Sets the number of reserved slots above the Player Limit that can be joined by reserved players
Allows users to login to any account even if the username doesn't match their character name
Allows users to register a username that doesn't necessarily match their character name
Whether or not to announce boss spawning or invasion starts
Whether or not to kick mediumcore players on death
The reason given if kicking a mediumcore players on death
Keywords: mediumcore kick reason, kicking, mediumcore players, death

Description: The reason given if banning a mediumcore player on death
Keywords: mediumcore ban reason, banning, mediumcore players, death

Description: Whether or not to ban mediumcore players on death
Whether or not to kick hardcore players on death
Sets the reason given when kicking hardcore players on death
If enabled, hardcore players will be banned on death
The reason given when banning hardcore players on death
Keywords: hardcore ban reason, banning, hardcore players, death

Description: Whether or not the server should output debug level messages related to system operation
Allows you to disable or enable protection against creating custom messages with death. Created for developers who came up with a more original solution to this problem
Disables IP bans by default, if no arguments are passed to the ban command
Prevents users from being able to login before they finish connecting
Prohibit the use of Zenith projectile with different objects instead of weapons
Prevents OnSecondUpdate checks from writing to the log file
Disables sending logs as messages to players with the log permission
Prevents users from being able to login with their client UUID
Displays a player's IP on join to users with the log permission
Whether or not to display chat messages above players' heads
Whether or not to announce a player's geographic location on join, based on their IP

If set to true, items given to players will be inserted directly into their inventory. Requires SSC. Otherwise, items given to players will spawn as dropped items. Experimental feature. May not work correctly or result in item loss
Keywords: give items, direct, inventory, dropped items

Description: Allows stacks in chests to go beyond the stack limit during world loading
Kick clients that don't send their UUID to the server
If set, kicks players when they get banned
Whether or not to kick users when they surpass the MaxDamage threshold

DisplayName: Kick On Heal Other Threshold Broken
Description: Whether or not to kick users when they surpass the HealOther threshold
Whether or not to kick users when they surpass the Projectile threshold

DisplayName: Kick On Tile Kill Threshold Broken
Description: Whether or not to kick users when they surpass the TileKill threshold

DisplayName: Kick On Tile Liquid Threshold Broken
Description: Whether or not to kick users when they surpass the TileLiquid threshold

DisplayName: Kick On Tile Paint Threshold Broken
Description: Whether or not to kick users when they surpass the TilePaint threshold

DisplayName: Kick On Tile Place Threshold Broken
Description: Whether or not to kick users when they surpass the TilePlace threshold
If GeoIP is enabled, this will kick users identified as being under a proxy
Prevent banned items from being spawned or given with commands
Prevent players from interacting with the world while they are dead
Prevents players from placing tiles with an invalid style
Keywords: prevent, players, placing tiles, invalid style

Description: Whether or not to ignore shrapnel from crystal bullets for the projectile threshold count
Keywords: ignore, shrapnel, crystal bullets, projectile threshold

Description: Remembers where a player left off, based on their IP. Does not persist through server restarts
Keywords: remember, player, left off, IP, server restarts

Description: Require all players to register or login before being allowed to play
Whether or not the server should suppress build permission failure warnings from regions, spawn point, or server edit failure
Keywords: suppress, build permission failure, warnings, regions, spawn point, server edit failure

Description: Changes the player name when using chat above heads. Starts with a player name wrapped in brackets, as per Terraria's formatting. Same formatting as ChatFormat without the message
Keywords: chat above heads, player name, chat format

Description: Changes in-game chat format: {0} = Group Name, {1} = Group Prefix, {2} = Player Name, {3} = Group Suffix, {4} = Chat Message
Keywords: in-game chat, chat format, group name, group prefix, player name, group suffix, chat message

Description: Specifies which string starts a command silently. Note: Will not function properly if the string length is bigger than 1
Specifies which string starts a command. Note: Will not function properly if the string length is bigger than 1
The default group name to place unregistered players under
Keywords: default guest group name, unregistered players

Description: The default group name to place newly registered users under
Keywords: default registration group name, newly registered users

Description: The reason given when kicking players that attempt to join while the server is full with no reserved slots available
Keywords: server full no reserved reason, kicking, players, server full, reserved slots
DefaultValue: Server is full. No reserved slots open.

Description: The reason given when kicking players that attempt to join while the server is full
Keywords: server full reason, kicking, players, server full

Description: The superadmin chat prefix
The superadmin chat suffix
Determines the BCrypt work factor to use. If increased, all passwords will be upgraded to new work-factor on verify. The number of computational rounds is 2^n. Increase with caution
Determines the range in tiles that a bomb can affect tiles from detonation point
Disables a player if this number of HealOtherPlayer packets is sent within 1 second
The maximum damage a player/NPC can inflict
The maximum HP a player can have, before equipment buffs
Number of failed login attempts before kicking the player
Keywords: maximum login attempts, failed login, security

Description: The maximum MP a player can have, before equipment buffs
The maximum damage a projectile can inflict
The minimum password length for new user accounts
Disable a player if this number of projectiles is created within 1 second
The number of seconds a player must wait before being respawned if there is a boss nearby. Use at your own risk
Keywords: respawn boss seconds, player, boss, respawn

Description: The number of seconds a player must wait before being respawned. Use at your own risk
How many NPCs a statue can spawn within 200 pixels(?) before it stops spawning
How many NPCs a statue can spawn within 600 pixels(?) before it stops spawning
How many NPCs a statue can spawn before it stops spawning
Disables a player and reverts their actions if this number of tile kills is exceeded within 1 second
Keywords: tile kill threshold, tile kills, player

Description: Disables a player if this number of liquid sets is exceeded within 1 second
Keywords: tile liquid threshold, liquid sets, player

Description: Disables a player if this number of tiles is painted within 1 second
Keywords: tile paint threshold, painted tiles, player

Description: Disables a player and reverts their actions if this number of tile places is exceeded within 1 second
Keywords: tile place threshold, tile places, player

Description: Enable or disable the REST API
Whether or not to log REST API connections

DisplayName: Enable REST API Token Endpoint Authentication
Description: Whether or not to require token authentication to use the public REST API endpoints

DisplayName: Maximum REST API Requests Per Interval
Description: Sets the maximum REST API requests in the bucket before denying requests
Keywords: REST maximum requests, REST requests, server

DisplayName: REST API Request Bucket Decrease Interval
Description: Sets how often in minutes the REST API requests bucket is decreased by one
Keywords: REST request bucket decrease interval, REST requests, server

Description: Sets the [ASP.NET Core 6.0 version](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download/dotnet/6.0) to install for TShock. NOTE: Update the server after switching versions!
This downloads a default backup exclude file to save space on backups by only saving specific directories. If this is disabled, you will need to manually delete the .backupExclude file it downloads
